discharge_summary: admission: 09/01/2020, discharge: 09/17/2020, stay: 16 d 13 h, location: ward, payer: SUS. A 67-year-old patient with a history of overweight, smoking, and major depression was admitted on 09/01 with a perforative acute abdomen, diagnosed after examinations. On the evening of 08/31, she sought care with abdominal pain, general malaise, and dyspnea. She had undergone hysterectomy on 08/30. On 09/01, she underwent exploratory laparotomy with a finding of intestinal perforation, with a suture of the lesion and placement of a peritoneostomy. She developed severe circulatory shock, probably due to peritonitis from contamination of the abdominal cavity, and antibiotic treatment was promptly started. She was re-addressed on 09/06, where an appendectomy and abdominal wall closure were performed. On 09/07, the patient's ventilatory status began to worsen, and a chest tomography scan was performed on 09/08, revealing low-load pulmonary embolism (5%) in addition to pneumonia. A multiresistant germ was isolated in a lung culture, with specific treatment directed at the patient. Given the clinical progression, a tracheostomy was indicated due to the need for prolonged mechanical ventilation. On 09/15, {omitted} prolonged cardiopulmonary arrest was reversed after approximately 20 minutes. The patient follow-up appointmented to the intensive care unit after the procedure, with mydriatic pupils and absence of reflexes. On 09/17, a computed tomography scan of the skull was performed, revealing anoxic-ischemic encephalopathy. Tests were performed to confirm brain death, which was confirmed on {omitted}. Perforating acute abdomen. 09/01: computed tomography of the abdomen and pelvis: pneumoperitoneum, ascites, signs of peritonitis, parietal hyperalces and edema of the loops 09/01: computed tomography of the chest, pulmonary congestion, cardiomegaly, bilateral pleural effusion, opacities suggestive of an inflammatory or infectious process 09/08: computed tomography of the chest, pulmonary thromboembolism with 5% embolic burden 09/17: computed tomography of the skull. 09/01: exploratory laparotomy, sigmoid suture, creation of peritoneostomy 09/06: review, touch-ups on previous surgery with appendectomy and closure of the abdominal wall 09/15: tracheostomy 09/15: bilateral chest drainage. death.
question: நான் மருத்துவமனைக்கு போக வேண்டுமா?
answer: அவர் 31 ஆகஸ்ட் 2019 அன்று மருத்துவமனையில் அனுமதிக்கப்பட்டார், மேலும் 1 செப்டம்பர் 2019 அன்று நோய்த்தொற்றால் இறந்தார்.

discharge_summary: admission: 09/01/2020, discharge: 09/17/2020, stay: 16 d 13 h, location: ward, payer: SUS. A 67-year-old patient with a history of overweight, smoking, and major depression was admitted on 09/01 with a perforative acute abdomen, diagnosed after examinations. On the evening of 08/31, she sought care with abdominal pain, general malaise, and dyspnea. She had undergone hysterectomy on 08/30. On 09/01, she underwent exploratory laparotomy with a finding of intestinal perforation, with a suture of the lesion and placement of a peritoneostomy. She developed severe circulatory shock, probably due to peritonitis from contamination of the abdominal cavity, and antibiotic treatment was promptly started. She was re-addressed on 09/06, where an appendectomy and abdominal wall closure were performed. On 09/07, the patient's ventilatory status began to worsen, and a chest tomography scan was performed on 09/08, revealing low-load pulmonary embolism (5%) in addition to pneumonia. A multiresistant germ was isolated in a lung culture, with specific treatment directed at the patient. Given the clinical progression, a tracheostomy was indicated due to the need for prolonged mechanical ventilation. On 09/15, {omitted} prolonged cardiopulmonary arrest was reversed after approximately 20 minutes. The patient follow-up appointmented to the intensive care unit after the procedure, with mydriatic pupils and absence of reflexes. On 09/17, a computed tomography scan of the skull was performed, revealing anoxic-ischemic encephalopathy. Tests were performed to confirm brain death, which was confirmed on {omitted}. discharge_summary: 1 severe acute respiratory syndrome, due to coronavirus. 2 new septic shock 01/14, fever hypotension, 3 acneiform eruption secondary to corticosteroid therapy, 4 pneumomediastinum airway injury? subcutaneous emphysema after depronation worsening ventilatory status, 5 new septic shock on 01/24 start of vasoactive drug, leukocytosis, 6 reactive adrenal insufficiency? hyperkalemia hyponatremia shock. admission: 01/06/2020, discharge: 03/03/2020, stay: 01 m 24 d 18 h, location: ward, payer: sus. clinical history [person] reports that he started with headache, myalgia and dry cough on 12/28, persisting with the same until 12/31, when he sought care and was prescribed prednisone, azithromycin, zinc and symptomatics. [person] started taking prescribed medications and on 02/01 he started with a fever, having performed a PCR for coronavirus with no result yet. On 03/01 he presented respiratory discomfort, having sought care on 04/01, when antibiotic therapy was changed to intravenous; the family member does not know which medication, however, there was no indication for hospital admission. [person] persisted with respiratory discomfort, having been hospitalized in the early hours of the same day. Emergency care unit report of oxygen saturation of 88% on room air, progressively worsening. He was admitted to the emergency unit on 06/01 with severe pulmonary involvement on chest x-ray, and was continued on antibiotic therapy initiated in the emergency care unit, ceftriaxone daily on 05/01 and prophylactic dexamethasone and enoxaparin initiated. He was admitted to [organization] on 07/01, requiring orotracheal intubation and central venous catheterization. He presented septic shock on 14/01, and his antibiotic regimen was changed. He remained in bed at [organization]. He developed new septic shock on 24/01, and began using fluconazole for fungal coverage. He developed pneumomediastinum on 26/01 due to airway injury, and underwent conservative treatment. He underwent tracheostomy on 29/01. He presented reactive adrenal insufficiency and acneiform rash related to corticosteroid therapy, in addition to diarrhea treated empirically with the hypothesis of pseudomembranous colitis. Acinetobacter baumanii was isolated in the tracheal aspirate, but was not treated due to the lack of clinical repercussion. He presented progressive clinical improvement and was transferred to [organization], where he remained stable. He underwent fibroscopy and was evaluated by speech therapy on 02/03, with no residual airway injury identified and a soft diet was released. He was decannulated on 03/03, remaining eupneic and in condition to be discharged. Good general condition, alert, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, Glasgow 15, oxygen saturation 94% in room air with capped tracheostomy, respiratory rate 28 inspirations per minute, muscle strength grade 4 in upper and lower limbs, regular heart rhythm in two beats, normal sound sounds without murmurs. Heart rate 76, vesicular breath sounds present, symmetrical, without adventitious sounds, without use of accessory muscles. Flaccid, flat abdomen, painless to palpation, without masses or visceromegaly. Extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, without edema, absence of swelling of the calves. Presence of pressure ulcer in the left lower limb, without signs of infection. Tracheostomy fibroscopy. I advise [person] on outpatient follow-up visits for: head and neck surgery on 03/15 speech therapy on 03/25 reassessment of diet physiatry to be scheduled I advise [person] on home care for tracheostomy orifice, diet, exercise and care. I prescribe symptomatic medications. Aminc, head and neck surgery, speech therapy, physiatry. Good general condition, slim, conscious and oriented, moving all 4 limbs actively with grade 4 muscle strength, still not able to walk alone. Tracheostomy orifice occluded with dressing and eating a soft diet. No pain complaints.

answer: 'உங்களுக்கு கொரோனா வைரஸ் பிரச்சனை இருந்தது.' 'உங்களுக்கு கொரோனா வைரஸ் பிரச்சனை இருந்தது,' மற்றும் 'வீட்டில் ஆக்சிஜன் அளவு 88% ஆக இருந்தது, அது மெதுவாக குறைந்து கொண்டிருந்தது.'

answer: அறிகுறிகள் இல்லாத ஒரு ஆண் நோயாளிக்கு அஸ்காரிடோசிஸ் இருப்பது கண்டறியப்பட்டது, ஆனால் சிகிச்சை மிகவும் விலை உயர்ந்ததாகக் கருதப்பட்டது.

discharge_summary: 1 severe acute respiratory syndrome, due to coronavirus. 2 new septic shock 01/14, fever hypotension, 3 acneiform eruption secondary to corticosteroid therapy, 4 pneumomediastinum airway injury? subcutaneous emphysema after depronation worsening ventilatory status, 5 new septic shock on 01/24 start of vasoactive drug, leukocytosis, 6 reactive adrenal insufficiency? hyperkalemia hyponatremia shock. admission: 01/06/2020, discharge: 03/03/2020, stay: 01 m 24 d 18 h, location: ward, payer: sus. clinical history [person] reports that he started with headache, myalgia and dry cough on 12/28, persisting with the same until 12/31, when he sought care and was prescribed prednisone, azithromycin, zinc and symptomatics. [person] started taking prescribed medications and on 02/01 he started with a fever, having performed a PCR for coronavirus with no result yet. On 03/01 he presented respiratory discomfort, having sought care on 04/01, when antibiotic therapy was changed to intravenous; the family member does not know which medication, however, there was no indication for hospital admission. [person] persisted with respiratory discomfort, having been hospitalized in the early hours of the same day. Emergency care unit report of oxygen saturation of 88% on room air, progressively worsening. He was admitted to the emergency unit on 06/01 with severe pulmonary involvement on chest x-ray, and was continued on antibiotic therapy initiated in the emergency care unit, ceftriaxone daily on 05/01 and prophylactic dexamethasone and enoxaparin initiated. He was admitted to [organization] on 07/01, requiring orotracheal intubation and central venous catheterization. He presented septic shock on 14/01, and his antibiotic regimen was changed. He remained in bed at [organization]. He developed new septic shock on 24/01, and began using fluconazole for fungal coverage. He developed pneumomediastinum on 26/01 due to airway injury, and underwent conservative treatment. He underwent tracheostomy on 29/01. He presented reactive adrenal insufficiency and acneiform rash related to corticosteroid therapy, in addition to diarrhea treated empirically with the hypothesis of pseudomembranous colitis. Acinetobacter baumanii was isolated in the tracheal aspirate, but was not treated due to the lack of clinical repercussion. He presented progressive clinical improvement and was transferred to [organization], where he remained stable. He underwent fibroscopy and was evaluated by speech therapy on 02/03, with no residual airway injury identified and a soft diet was released. He was decannulated on 03/03, remaining eupneic and in condition to be discharged. Good general condition, alert, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, Glasgow 15, oxygen saturation 94% in room air with capped tracheostomy, respiratory rate 28 inspirations per minute, muscle strength grade 4 in upper and lower limbs, regular heart rhythm in two beats, normal sound sounds without murmurs. Heart rate 76, vesicular breath sounds present, symmetrical, without adventitious sounds, without use of accessory muscles. Flaccid, flat abdomen, painless to palpation, without masses or visceromegaly. ExtremITIES: palpable peripheral pulses, without edema, absence of swelling of the calves. Presence of pressure ulcer in the left lower limb, without signs of infection. Tracheostomy fibroscopy. I advise [person] on outpatient follow-up visits for: head and neck surgery on 03/15 speech therapy on 03/25 reassessment of diet physiatry to be scheduled I advise [person] on home care for tracheostomy orifice, diet, exercise and care. I prescribe symptomatic medications. Aminc, head and neck surgery, speech therapy, physiatry. Good general condition, slim, conscious and oriented, moving all 4 limbs actively with grade 4 muscle strength, still not able to walk alone. Tracheostomy orifice occluded with dressing and eating a soft diet. No pain complaints.
question: Why do I need a tracheostomy?
answer: He was on a 'fibroscope' and had no symptoms. He had a de-tubilation (tube removal) on 3 March 2010. After discharge, he was on drainage with a 'tracheostomy'.

discharge_summary: 1. pneumonia, pulmonary metastasis? negative external rt pcr on 06/21 verified by surveillance on 06/23 2. syncope to be clarified neurocardiogenic? investigation suspended 3. consumptive syndrome due to duodenal papilla neoplasia. admission: 06/23/2020, discharge: 06/30/2020, stay: 07 d 05 h, location: ward, payer: sus. history of current illness admission: [person] referred from the emergency care unit, where he was hospitalized for 4 days. reports that 3 days ago he had a sudden episode of loss of consciousness, not preceded by prodromes, with follow-up appointment after a few seconds. level of consciousness without dysfunctions afterwards, without release of sphincters. reports only significant asthenia and fatigue associated. had 2 of these episodes on this day. had already had another similar syncope 20 days ago. He had several episodes of vomiting, which started 5 days ago and improved 2 days ago. His family called [organization] due to his condition. During the evaluation by the transport team, [person] reported an episode of fever (38.3 °C) and dry cough since 06/10. During hospitalization at [organization], he was given antibiotic therapy and referred [person] to our services. His syncope did not recur. He reported diarrhea for 15 days and improvement for 3 days, which is why his chemotherapy cycle was suspended. Upon admission, [person] was hemodynamically stable, breathing with a mask with a reservoir at 10 L/min, without respiratory distress, and denying any complaints at the moment. He is afebrile. Edema of the lower limbs, crackles, and reduced vesicular breath sounds on the left. [person] was pale and emaciated. No relevant results. Pleural fluid puncture and chest drain. Pneumonia, no pending tests. Antibiotic therapy: cefepime and clarithromycin. [person] evolves into death.
question: Do I have to go to the hospital?
answer: நீங்கள் 'அவசர சிகிச்சைப் பிரிவுக்கு' அனுப்பப்பட்டீர்கள். 3 நாட்களுக்கு முன்பு நீங்கள் 'திடீரென மயங்கி விழுந்தீர்கள்', உங்களுக்கு அதிக காய்ச்சல் மற்றும் வலி இருந்தது. உங்களுக்கு அதிக காய்ச்சல் (38.3 டிகிரி செல்சியஸ்) மற்றும் வறட்டு இருமல் இருந்தது.

question: Yew! Why are you blocking the medicine ( नर्स)
answer: ஜூன் 20 அன்று, அவர் சிறுநீரக செயலிழப்பு மதிப்பீட்டிற்காக மருத்துவமனையில் அனுமதிக்கப்பட்டார், மேலும் ஜூன் 14 அன்று அவருக்கு த்ரோம்போஸ் செய்யப்பட்ட ரத்த உறைவு இருப்பதாகக் கண்டறியப்பட்டது, இது ஒரு தமனியில் ஏற்பட்ட ரத்த உறைவு ஆகும், இது ஒரு மாரடைப்புக்குக் காரணமாக இருந்தது.

discharge_summary: 1. coronavirus infection onset of symptoms 02/17 orotracheal intubation 02/24 extubation 03/08 2. septic shock from pulmonary focus requiring vasoactive drug resolved: antibiotic therapy: ceftriaxone 02/23 03/02 clarithromycin 04/24 03/02 corticosteroid therapy: 02/24 03/09 3. critically ill polyneuropathy grade 2 strength upper limbs and lower limbs 4. pressure injury left lower limb grade i 5. your appointment scheduled with gynecology. on 03/24 for investigation. admission: 02/24/2020, discharge: 03/19/2020, stay: 22 d 21 h, location: ward, payer: sus. current: [person] with severe acute respiratory syndrome due to coronavirus, onset of symptoms on 02/17, requiring orotracheal intubation due to respiratory failure on 02/24, due to the possibility of associated bacterial pneumonia, antibiotic therapy with ceftriaxone and clarithromycin was performed. [person] presented satisfactory clinical evolution, and extubation was performed on 03/08, without complications. Gradual weaning of oxygen therapy was performed, and oxygen was withdrawn on 03/17, at the time comfortable in room air. Due to prolonged use of neuromuscular blocker to manage mechanical ventilation, [person] developed critically ill polyneuropathy, currently with grade II motor strength in the upper and lower limbs. He also has a pressure injury in the left lower limb, which is improving, with no signs of infection. Insulin therapy was started to manage hyperglycemia, with weaning after optimization of oral metformin. It is worth mentioning that during hospitalization [person] presented abnormal vaginal bleeding, and an appointment with gynecology was scheduled for 03/24 for investigation. Good general condition, hydrated, normal color, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile; respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds with crackles on a residual basis, without respiratory distress; cardiac auscultation: regular heart rhythm in two beats; normal sound sounds without murmurs; abdomen: innocent; extremities without edema, free calves, capillary refill time less than 3 s, ulcer on the left lower limb, grade I. therapeutic plan: I speak with [person] about the importance of performing pulmonary and motor physiotherapy to manage polyneuropathy in critically ill patients. He states that he will pay for home physiotherapy. He is referred to a basic health unit: management of hypertension and diabetes. Dressing of ulcer in the left lower limb region. I prescribe a dressing with AGE. Guidance from the nutrition team regarding the home diet. I follow-up appointment to the GEAD outpatient clinic on 04/26 for clinical reassessment. I follow-up appointment to the speech therapy outpatient clinic on 05/05. I schedule a pelvic ultrasound for 03/22 and a surgical gynecology outpatient clinic for 03/24. I investigate uterine bleeding. against reference [organization]. Good general condition, maintaining polyneuropathy in critically ill patients, with improvement in motor strength grade II.
question: நான் மருத்துவமனைக்கு போக வேண்டுமா?
answer: அவர் கொரோனா வைரஸால் ஏற்பட்ட கடுமையான சுவாசக் கோளாறு நோய்க்குறி காரணமாக 24 பிப்ரவரி 2020 அன்று மருத்துவமனையில் அனுமதிக்கப்பட்டு, அவருக்கு மூச்சுக்குழாய் பொருத்தப்பட்டது.

question: அட, நான் மருத்துவமனைக்கு போகணுமா?
answer: அவர் 'சதாம்', 'பெரெஸ்', 'பெஹோஸ்' மற்றும் 'ஆசார்' ஆகிய படங்களில் இருந்தார். அவரது இரத்த அழுத்தம் 6 mmHg க்கு பதிலாக 60x00 mmHg ஆக இருந்ததாலும், அவரது கைகள் மற்றும் கால்கள் மரத்துப்போனதாலும் போக்குவரத்து குழு அவரை காப்பாற்றியது.

question: Do you need a male doctor for your big pain?
answer: இரண்டாவது பாதிக்கப்பட்டவர் சுவாசக் குழாயுடன் மருத்துவமனையில் அனுமதிக்கப்பட்டார், மேலும் அவர் "நுரையீரல் தமனி அடைப்பு" மற்றும் "வன்முறையான நிர்வாக தோல்வி" காரணமாக விசாரிக்கப்பட்டார்.

question: Why does septic tank water leak?
answer: He was diagnosed with " septic shock abdominal focus " and " septic shock hematosis ". His symptoms included "general weakness, diarrhea, and a lowered creatinine" and "hemodynamic instability" (red streaks), so he had to be put on "norepinephrine" (a drug that increases blood pressure).

question: இதயத்தின் செயல்பாடு (எக்கோ கார்டியோகிராம்) எவ்வாறு காட்டப்படுகிறது?
answer: உணவுக்குழாய் எதிரொலி வரைவி (டிசிஇ) "கணிசமாகக் குறைந்த இதயச்சுருக்க எதிரொலி வரைவி வேகம்", "பகுதிப் பகுதி டாப்ளர் வேகம்" மற்றும் "லேசான இதய பை வால்வு பற்றாக்குறை" ஆகியவற்றை வெளிப்படுத்தியது.

question: Hey, what's wrong with your ear, brother?
answer: நீங்கள் 'அசாதாரண மூளை இறப்பு' ஆய்வில் பங்கேற்றீர்கள். 'எலக்ட்ரோ கார்டியோகிராம் பதிவு 03/15' உங்கள் குடும்ப உறுப்பினர்கள் கண்டறிந்த எந்த 'ஏட்ரியல் ஃபைப்ரிலேஷனையும்' கண்டுபிடிக்கவில்லை, மேலும் 'முன்னரே இருந்த நிலைமைகளை' தீர்மானித்தது.

discharge_summary: 1. pneumonia, pulmonary metastasis? negative external rt pcr on 06/21 verified by surveillance on 06/23 2. syncope to be clarified neurocardiogenic? investigation suspended 3. consumptive syndrome due to duodenal papilla neoplasia. admission: 06/23/2020, discharge: 06/30/2020, stay: 07 d 05 h, location: ward, payer: sus. history of current illness admission: [person] referred from the emergency care unit, where he was hospitalized for 4 days. reports that 3 days ago he had a sudden episode of loss of consciousness, not preceded by prodromes, with follow-up appointment after a few seconds. level of consciousness without dysfunctions afterwards, without release of sphincters. reports only significant asthenia and fatigue associated. had 2 of these episodes on this day. had already had another similar syncope 20 days ago. He had several episodes of vomiting, which started 5 days ago and improved 2 days ago. His family called [organization] due to his condition. During the evaluation by the transport team, [person] reported an episode of fever (38.3 °C) and dry cough since 06/10. During hospitalization at [organization], he was given antibiotic therapy and referred [person] to our services. His syncope did not recur. He reported diarrhea for 15 days and improvement for 3 days, which is why his chemotherapy cycle was suspended. Upon admission, [person] was hemodynamically stable, breathing with a mask with a reservoir at 10 L/min, without respiratory distress, and denying any complaints at the moment. He is afebrile. Edema of the lower limbs, crackles, and reduced vesicular breath sounds on the left. [person] was pale and emaciated. No relevant results. Pleural fluid puncture and chest drain. Pneumonia, no pending tests. Antibiotic therapy: cefepime and clarithromycin. [person] evolves into death.
question: நான் மருத்துவமனைக்கு போக வேண்டுமா?
answer: He was diagnosed with "paraplegia, digital dyspnea, horseshoes," "hypoxemia", "purpura," and "hypotension."

discharge_summary: admission: 23/02/2020, discharge: 09/03/2020, stay: 14 d, location: ward, payer: sus. [person], 65 years old, born and raised in [address], widower. problem: asthenia, worsening of basal dyspnea, drowsiness, desaturation, bladder indwelling urinary catheter with pyuria, hypotension and worsening of perfusion diagnostic hypotheses: 1. mixed shock: septic of urinary focus, weaning from norepinephrine on 25/02, cardiogenic, heart failure, due to decompensated alcoholic cardiomyopathy profile, weaning from dobutamine on 03/03 started tridil 26/02 and oral vasodilators on 27/02/2020. 2. acute kidney injury kdigo 3 creatinine: 6.57 urea: 348: acute ischemic tubular necrosis secondary to infection, SCR type 1 on renal replacement therapy since 02/23/2020. cultures: blood culture 02/23/2020: carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae in 2 samples at 22 and 42 h. urine culture 02/23/2020: carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae. history: systemic arterial hypertension, hypothyroidism? chronic liver disease, active significant alcoholism, active smoking 110 pack-years, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, presumed pulmonology evaluation on 08/18. Evolution: despite the culture showing Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase, [person] showed a good clinical response to meropenem, thus concluding the use of meropenem 1000 mg 1x/day 500 mg post renal replacement therapy for 14 days dated 02/23/2020. He evolved with improvement in infectious parameters, afebrile, with no genitourinary or cardiorespiratory complaints. Latest laboratory tests: Hb: 12.4 ht: 37 platelets: 123 gb: 7.5 without deviation to the left. Undergoing follow-up with nephrology, daily hemodialysis was performed. Schedule: with completion of antibiotic therapy and maintenance of improvement in clinical parameters, discharged from [organization] on 03/09/2020. Scheduled by nephrology for follow-up on acute dialysis on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, in the first shift.

question: எனது கிரியேட்டினின் அளவு அசாதாரணமாக உள்ளது, எனக்கு டயாலிசிஸ் செய்ய வேண்டுமா?
answer: உங்கள் குருத்துவாராவின் கடைசி முடிவு 3' (கிரியேட்டினின்: 6.57) ஆகும், இது 'தொற்று' காரணமாக ஏற்பட்டது. உங்கள் குருத்துவாராவின் மாற்று (டயாலிசிஸ்) அட்டவணை 2/23/2020 அன்று சரி செய்யப்பட்டது.

question: I went to the hospital. Did I die?
answer: இதற்கான அடிப்படை காரணம் பொதுவாக "நோய்க்காரணவியல்" போன்ற ஒரு தொற்று செயல்முறையாகும், ஆனால் ஆஸ்பிரேஷன் நிமோனியா அல்லது இரத்தச் சர்க்கரைக் குறைவும் ஒரு காரணமாக இருக்கலாம்.

question: Should I praise the tube?
answer: நீங்கள் மே 5 அன்று ஒகாமா மற்றும் டோக்கியோ மருத்துவமனைகளுக்கு வந்தீர்கள். மே 12 அன்று, உங்களுக்கு ஹைபோக்ஸீமியா (குறைந்த ஆக்சிஜன்), ஹைபோக்ஸியா (குறைந்த ஆக்சிஜன்) மற்றும் எண்டோட்ராக்கியல் குழாய் (ஈடிடி) பொருத்தப்பட்டது.

discharge_summary: admission: 12/06, discharge: 12/21, stay: 14 d 11 h, location: ward, payer: sus. 1. heart failure profile c dobutamine on 12/07 and 12/08, 2. abscess in the left thigh, osteomyelitis in the pubis, fournier's syndrome, drainage on 12/03 with ultrasound and drain placement on 12/15, treatment with ceftriaxone guided by culture of abscess escherichia coli multi s colonized antibiotic therapy after shock, incision in intensive care unit on 12/17 with abundant purulent secretion, {omitted}. 3. septic shock from cutaneous urinary focus on 12/16 polymyxin d0 12/15 amikacin and vancomycin on 12/17, 4. chronic kidney disease acute dialysis by fistula on 12/16 5. cardiorespiratory arrest with pulseless electrical activity, 10 minutes after intubation report of previous bradycardia, follow-up appointment after 1 minute of cardiopulmonary resuscitation, 6. vt with pulse after cardiorespiratory arrest, effective electrical cardioversion with a shock. [person] presenting with instability in the last half hour, requiring norepinephrine elevation up to 1.5 mcg/kg/min. progresses with bradycardia, QRS widening, and worsening shock. Given the hyperkalemia even after hemodialysis, 2 ampoules of calcium gluconate and 100 ml of bicarbonate were administered, and the respiratory rate was increased on the ventilator in order to reduce pco2 and consequently k. 2 ampoules of atropine were administered without benefit. [person] progressed to asystolic cardiorespiratory arrest, {omitted} in refractory shock. I declare {omitted} dead, due to absence of central pulses, pupils in fixed mydriasis, absence of heart sounds and asytole on the monitor, as well as absence of brainstem reflexes. The body was released. I request contact with the family. I await the death certificate to be completed. Death. Drainage of Fournier's gangrene. Death.
question: How did my childhood friend get so sick?
answer: அவருக்கு வலது கையில் ஒரு புண் இருந்தது, மேலும் அவர் STW மற்றும் கிரோன் நோயால் பாதிக்கப்பட்டிருந்தார். புண் வளர்ப்பு எஸ்கெரிக்கியா கோலிக்கு சாதகமாக இருப்பது கண்டறியப்பட்டது. செப்டிக் தோல் மற்றும் சிறுநீர் பாதை நோய்த்தொற்றுகள் இருப்பதாக சந்தேகம் இருந்தது.

question: When should I start giving him medicine?

question: நான் எவ்வளவு பெரியவனாக இருக்கிறேன் என்று தோன்றுகிறதா?
answer: உங்களுக்கு நுண்ணுயிர் எதிர்ப்பிகள், குளோஸ்ட்ரிடியம் விஷம் இருக்கிறதா என்று பரிசோதனை மற்றும் மெட்ரோனிடசோல் கொடுக்கப்படுகிறது.
